text: Mary Louise Tobin (born November 11, 1918) is an American jazz singer. Tobin was born in Aubrey, Texas, but raised in Denton, Texas. She appeared with Benny Goodman, Bobby Hackett, Will Bradley, and Jack Jenney. Tobin introduced I Didn't Know What Time It Was with Benny Goodmanâ€™s band in 1939. Her biggest hit with Goodman was There'll Be Some Changes Made, which was number two on the Hit Parade in 1941 for 15 weeks.The Louise Tobin and Peanuts Hucko Jazz Collection, Texas A&M; University-Commerce Library ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1918 births Category:American jazz singers Category:Singers from Texas Category:2022 deaths Category:20th-century American singers Category:American centenarians Category:People from Denton, Texas
title: Louise Tobin
